Office of the Dean of Students     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Office of the Dean of Students      Office of the Dean of Students   Main Menu    About           Our Work, Mission and Values    Our Team    Student Handbook    Policies    Student Government    Religious Workers' Association    Request a Presentation    Location         Assistance           Academic Concerns    Health & Personal Concerns    Campus Life    Faculty & Staff Resources    U & I Care         Community Standards           Academic Integrity    Personal & Community Integrity    Community Standards Forms    Community Standards Process    Get Involved    Record Requests    Assessment & Reports         Student Veterans           Benefits and Forms    Get Connected    Resources for Students and Families    FAQs    Contact Student Veteran Affairs         Student Legal     Eyebrow menu    Veteran Forms    Community Standards Forms    U & I Care    Student Affairs    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search               View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Office of the Dean of Students    About    Request a Presentation        Request a Presentation       Request a Presentation   Thank you for your interest in having the Dean of Students’ Office present to your group. Please consult our list of existing presentations below, and email us at dos@uic.edu to let us know some key details about your group and event. You can also email us to let us know you’re interested in a topic not currently on the list. Please make requests for existing presentations at least a week in advance, and note new presentations will require a longer lead time.       Request a Presentation     ACADEMIC INTEGRITY AT UIC         ACADEMIC INTEGRITY AT UIC   Gain a better understanding of the UIC Student Disciplinary Policy’s Academic Integrity section. Participants will understand the various types of violations, possible conduct pathways, and prevention strategies. Student presentations include academic misconduct scenarios while faculty and staff presentations include national research on best practices.  Possible Audiences : Faculty, Students, Staff        DEAN OF STUDENTS AT UIC         DEAN OF STUDENTS AT UIC   Hear an overview of the various ways the Office of the Dean of Students serves UIC. Participants will receive an introduction to several of the functions housed within the office, including Student Assistance, Community Standards, Student Legal Services, Veterans’ Affairs and the U&I Care Program, and learn how each serves various constituencies throughout campus.  Possible Audiences: Faculty, Students, Staff        ENGAGING WITH COMMUNITY STANDARDS         ENGAGING WITH COMMUNITY STANDARDS   Gain a better understanding of the UIC Student Disciplinary Policy’s Standards of Conduct and Resolution Methods. Participants will understand their contract with the community; how to engage in the hearing process; and where they can reach out for guidance.  Possible Audiences: Students, Student Organizations        NEGOTIATING EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS FOR DENTISTS         NEGOTIATING EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS FOR DENTISTS   Learn what to look for when signing your first agreement as an associate dentist or independent contractor.  Topics include:  compensation structure, restrictive covenants, common mistakes to avoid, and termination.  Discusses ways to maximize bargaining power with potential employers.  Possible Audiences: College of Dentistry Students, Faculty, and Staff        STUDENT LEGAL SERVICES (SLS) AT UIC         STUDENT LEGAL SERVICES (SLS) AT UIC   Introduction to the various types of legal cases SLS handles on behalf of students.  Also discussed:  eligibility for the services, how to set up an appointment, cases the office doesn’t handle, whether fees are involved, and the office confidentiality policy.  Possible Audiences:  Faculty, Students, Staff        STUDENT VETERANS AFFAIRS GENERAL INFORMATION         STUDENT VETERANS AFFAIRS GENERAL INFORMATION   Learn about the general services of Student Veterans Affairs.  Participants will become aware of the various educational benefits awarded student veterans, reservists, and dependents at the state and federal level.  Possible Audience : Faculty, Students, Staff        VETERAN AFFAIRS - STUDENT ORIENTATION         VETERAN AFFAIRS - STUDENT ORIENTATION   This presentation informs current and new students about the process of certifying their GI Bill Benefits at UIC.  It will allow students to ask questions pertinent to their specific benefit and meet Student Veterans Affairs staff.  Possible Audience: Students, Prospective Students                About           Our Work, Mission and Values    Our Team    Student Handbook     UIC History, Traditions, Symbols    Student Life    Student Services    Policies    Undergraduate Catalog    Graduate Catalog      Policies    Student Government     Elections      Religious Workers' Association    Request a Presentation    Location
